title: Origin Energy pushes back on activist resolutions
text:
Origin Energy chairman Gordon Cairns has firmly stood behind the utility's position on environmental and social governance, telling shareholders that many of the assertions of minority shareholder groups looking to force change in those areas "lack scientific rigour, peer review, or are simply incorrect".

Fronting the annual general meeting in Sydney on Wednesday, Mr Cairns declared Origin's emissions reduction targets were consistent with the goals of the Paris climate accord of December 2015.

He said Origin is "playing a leadership role" in Australia's carbon reduction by committing to exit coal power generation by 2032 and by its target for renewables and storage.

The resolutions put forward by Market Forces and the Australian Centre for Corporate Responsibility "do not reflect the views of the vast majority of shareholders, nor of your board," Mr Cairns said in his formal address.

Market Forces wants Origin to close its Eraring coal power plant by 2030. SMH

Several resolutions were put forward by minority shareholder groups pushing for more aggressive action to cut greenhouse gas emissions and close Origin's large Eraring coal power plant, and questioning traditional owner consent for drilling in the Northern Territory, among other issues.
description: Chairman Gordon Cairns has backed Origin Energy's stance on emissions reduction and social governance.
